etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree") with flames around it representing sacrifice -> 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") added for emphasis -> 呂(呂) (lǚ, "spine") often added as a phonetic -> simplified to 日(日) (rì, "sun") in later forms
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a tree surrounded by flames, symbolizing a sacrificial fire. The addition of 火(火) emphasized the fire's role, and 呂(呂) was incorporated for phonetic purposes, but later evolved into the 日(日) component, focusing on phonetic associations.
